annotation.spannedText: Vaccines reduce the risk of infection by working with the body’s natural defenses to help it safely develop immunity to disease

classMention.mentionClass: Vaccines reduce the risk of infection by working with the body’s natural defenses to help it safely develop immunity to disease

annotation.spannedText: Vaccines help develop immunity by imitating an infection, but this “imitation” infection does not cause illness

classMention.mentionClass: Vaccines help develop immunity by imitating an infection, but this “imitation” infection does not cause illness

annotation.spannedText: It does ... cause the immune system to develop the same response as it does to a real infection so the body can recognize and fight the vaccine-preventable disease in the future

classMention.mentionClass: It does ... cause the immune system to develop the same response as it does to a real infection so the body can recognize and fight the vaccine-preventable disease in the future

annotation.spannedText: As children get older, they require additional doses of some vaccines for best protection

classMention.mentionClass: As children get older, they require additional doses of some vaccines for best protection

annotation.spannedText: Older kids also need to be protected against additional diseases they may encounter

classMention.mentionClass: Older kids also need to be protected against additional diseases they may encounter

annotation.spannedText: all of those shots add up to your baby being protected against 14 infectious diseases

classMention.mentionClass: all of those shots add up to your baby being protected against 14 infectious diseases

annotation.spannedText: Young babies can get very ill from vaccine-preventable diseases

classMention.mentionClass: Young babies can get very ill from vaccine-preventable diseases

annotation.spannedText: these vaccines do not overload the immune system

classMention.mentionClass: these vaccines do not overload the immune system

annotation.spannedText: The antigens in vaccines come from weakened or killed germs so they cannot cause serious illness

classMention.mentionClass: The antigens in vaccines come from weakened or killed germs so they cannot cause serious illness

annotation.spannedText: Like any medication, vaccines, can cause side effects

classMention.mentionClass: Like any medication, vaccines, can cause side effects

annotation.spannedText: The most common side effects are mild

classMention.mentionClass: The most common side effects are mild

annotation.spannedText: On the other hand, many vaccine-preventable disease symptoms can be serious, or even deadly

classMention.mentionClass: On the other hand, many vaccine-preventable disease symptoms can be serious, or even deadly

annotation.spannedText: Even though many of these diseases are rare in this country, they still occur around the world and can be brought into the U.S., putting unvaccinated children at risk

classMention.mentionClass: Even though many of these diseases are rare in this country, they still occur around the world and can be brought into the U.S., putting unvaccinated children at risk

annotation.spannedText: The side effects associated with getting vaccines are almost always minor (such as redness and swelling where the shot was given) and go away within a few days

classMention.mentionClass: The side effects associated with getting vaccines are almost always minor (such as redness and swelling where the shot was given) and go away within a few days

annotation.spannedText: Serious side effects following vaccination, such as severe allergic reaction, are very rare and doctors and clinic staff are trained to deal with them

classMention.mentionClass: Serious side effects following vaccination, such as severe allergic reaction, are very rare and doctors and clinic staff are trained to deal with them

annotation.spannedText: There is no evidence that the small amounts of thimerosal in flu vaccines causes any harm, except for minor reactions like redness and swelling at the injection site

classMention.mentionClass: There is no evidence that the small amounts of thimerosal in flu vaccines causes any harm, except for minor reactions like redness and swelling at the injection site

annotation.spannedText: The United States’ long-standing vaccine safety system ensures that vaccines are as safe as possible

classMention.mentionClass: The United States’ long-standing vaccine safety system ensures that vaccines are as safe as possible

annotation.spannedText: currently, the United States has the safest vaccine supply in its history

classMention.mentionClass: currently, the United States has the safest vaccine supply in its history
